Column Comment.0: SYSTEM IDENTIFIER: A unique identifier for a data storage system, such as adatabase or XML schema.
Column Comment.1: TABLE NAME: The name of the table within the schema.
Column Comment.2: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.3: CODE VERSION OBSERVATION NUMBER: Unique number identifying the versionof the reference value that is stored in this table.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: DEFINITION: the definition of the meaning of the code value, as applied in businesscontext. Ideally, these definitions may often be taken from the source documentwhere the values were obtained. Please be sure to reference and atrtributedefinitions appropriately.
Column Comment.6: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.7: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.8: LANGUAGE: The form of a means of communicating ideas or feelings by the use ofconventionalized signs, sounds, gestures, or marks having understood meanings.Usually the language used in a document, proceding, process or appllication.
Column Comment.9: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.10: PREFERRED INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating that generally this code version ispreferred for the use indicated by the owner ba id, application or procedure that isreferenced for the version.
Column Comment.11: REFERENCE TABLE GUID: If the value in this row is transposed into the underlyingreference table, y u may store the GUID in the reference table here to simplifyqueries.
Column Comment.12: REFERENCE TABLE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag that indicates that this value will becaptured in the underlying reference table.
Column Comment.13: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.14: SOURCE DOCUMENT: The source from which a reference value is obtained, suchas a government publication, web site, ISO standard etc.
Column Comment.15: USE RULE: the use rule that governs the application of this code version. May beused to create reports, regulatory submissions etc.
Column Comment.16: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for a business associate, such as aperson, company, regulatory agency, government or consortium. In this case, thebusiness associate who is the owner of the use of a code alias.
Column Comment.17: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.18: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.19: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.20: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.21: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.22: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.23: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
